urls.description: Playbooks for bottom-up SaaS and the craft of company-building. Click to read Bottom Up by David Sacks, a Substack publication with tens of thousands of readers.

tweets.text:
1/ On SBF & FTX

I think this is not going to be a hugely long thread (I think).

It is not going to be hugely insightful for anyone deep in crypto.

But maybe it will help as a reference to our friends in the media who are struggling quite a bit with this topic

Dear Media,

Do you want a simple description of HOW @SBF_FTX did what he did?

Why does nobody seem capable of pinning Sam down? His SECRET is, when asked pointed questions, he switches to market-plumbing speak, hiding behind lingo.

Let me help you understand SBF's moves.
🧵👇

@DavidSacks Plenty of folks still planning on 3x but will do 2x, which means they will spend as if they are growing 3x but will only 2x growth.

This is a quick way to die
2x is the new 3x.

This could become a vicious cycle:

Layoffs —> Seat Contraction —> Sales Slowdown —> Cut Costs —> Layoffs

Repeat.

Salesforce, the bellwether SaaS company, saw Net New ARR decrease by 2/3rds in the most recent quarter. That’s a huge slowdown. But also, it implies the need to cut over $2 billion of sales & mktg if it wants to maintain CAC payback at reasonable levels. https://t.co/63iZY9XEch
@DavidSacks Wow 4 versions of this Tweet. Settle on it Rainman!
@DavidSacks First tweet was better because the mind fills in the “easy money” part which makes a more stark metaphor
@DavidSacks You know we understood what you meant the first time right? https://t.co/ACnjFSscwO

Salesforce added ~$360m of net new ARR in the quarter (using subscription rev x 4 as proxy for ARR so it's imperfect but directionally accurate) off of $3.4B of S&M spend last quarter. When net new ARR slows (they added $1.1B last Q) and S&M doesn't, payback baloons
@DavidSacks ChatGPT explains what David Sacks means here for the layman: https://t.co/aJ7KJBo7pb

The entrepreneurial capitalist is attacked as a monopolist, while the corporate monopolist is defended as a capitalist.

Abolish the self-made billionaires...but Apple is a private company, so it can do what it wants...

PayPal Co-Founder @DavidSacks exposes collusion between Big Tech and the DC Uniparty as Apple threatens to thwart Free Speech by removing Twitter from the App Store:

"They're willing to kneecap their political opponents with censorship if that's what the party in power requires" https://t.co/qGIvVEgiVt

Silicon Valley was the product of aggressive public policy. The key technologies of our digital age were not the happy accidents of “permissionless innovation” in the “self-regulating” market, but of deliberate and prolonged government action. @wellscking  https://t.co/IOpZKvDH59

@DavidSacks The crime would’ve been yes, but the speed at which customer assets were acquired and lost was largely possible due to the unregulated nature of crypto, and the ability to be branded broadly as a visionary was driven by the imaginary and ethereal value of crypto.

Describing what happened as “a run on the bank” is deceptive since FTX was not a bank. Banks have the right to lend customer deposits; FTX did not. Customers kept those deposits for one purpose only: to trade. Appropriating those funds crossed the brightest of all red lines.

The same media outlets that have no qualms about publishing career-ending hit pieces suddenly declare themselves unable to judge whether fraud took place. That’s a question only the DOJ can answer! But they can declare it to be “just” a run on the bank. https://t.co/FwswbAtG1S

a Twitter implosion "could make getting reliable information on this site during Tuesday's elections impossible." Completely wrong, Twitter had a smooth night on 11/8.

https://t.co/6Tu5Oqhc2f
Found in closet at Twitter HQ fr 🤣🤣 https://t.co/3xSI3KvvHk
@elonmusk My God you just went and bought the institution most responsible for accelerating wokeness and are publicly rummaging through the relics of their broken dreams.
Hard to say what will happen over time, but everyone in Silicon Valley is watching this and asking if their companies can operate leaner https://t.co/Qkvdl61PFG
@DavidSacks @MagnoliaPics @mcuban Perhaps a guest appearance by @mcuban on the podcast is in order?
@DavidSacks @MagnoliaPics Great movie.  Congrats ! And of course 😀
